comments:
I created a new install with the I20021210 build. I imported these new plugins 
into my old workspace (except I kept my debug plug-ins as source). I can no 
longer lanuch a self hosting workspace. I get this in the .log

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Dec 10, 2002 14:00:08.926
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.IllegalAccessError: 
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginClassLoader tried to access method 
org/eclipse/core/internal/boot/InternalBootLoader.useClassLoaderProperties()Z
	at

However, I can launch the I20021210 build using the eclipse.exe on a new empty 
workspace.

This smells like the new code added to support classloading enhancements, but I 
will let the Core team give the verdict.

Darin, which type of binary projects are you using? (copy or use in-place?)
I will try and replicate this problem on my machine.
Thanks.

Darin's setup:
- running the 1204 build
- imported binary plugins from the 1210 build

I had problems myself self-hosting with the 1204 build but the problems were 
fixed in the 1206 nightly. (and should be in the latest integration build)

The stack trace above would result if the platform was trying to be launched 
with a runtime plugin from 1210 mixed with a boot plugin from 1204. (we changed 
the visibility of the specified method in this build)

We will see if this is still a problem when the new integration build for today 
is finished.

I have no problems using a completely new fresh install with the latest 
integration build. OK to close.
